definitions.definition: a narrow line of light, heat or other energy

examples.text: The last of the sun's rays shone on the grass.
The windows were shining in the reflected rays of the setting sun.
A ray of sunlight fell on the table.
Her brooch caught the rays of the setting sun.
The moon cast pale rays of light on the ground.
They basked in sun's warm golden rays.
When the sun's rays hit the earth, a lot of heat is reflected back into space.
a stream sparkling in the rays of the June sun
creams which filter out the sun's harmful ultraviolet rays
the dying rays of a winter sun
the moon's rays filtering through the trees

definitions.definition: a small amount of something good or of something that you are hoping for

examples.text: There was just one small **ray of hope**.
The one ray of light in this whole affair is that justice has been done.

definitions.definition: a sea fish with a large broad flat body and a long tail, that is used for food
the second note of a major scale
to sit or lie in the sun, especially in order to get a suntan
a person or thing that makes life brighter or more cheerful

examples.text: My nephew is a little ray of sunshine.

wordOrigin: senses 1 to 2 Middle English: from Old French rai, based on Latin radius ‘spoke, ray’.sense 3 Middle English: from Old French raie, from Latin raia.sense 4 Middle English re, representing (as an arbitrary name for the note) the first syllable of resonare, taken from a Latin hymn.
